reviewText: Esta edición de cuatro películas es muy interesante. El principal problema radica en que solo esta doblado en francés y no viene la edición en castellano de ninguna de las películas, donde solo podemos encontrarlas subtituladas, menos Papillon que está subtitulado en francés e inglés. Ahí si hubo un gran error de Warner.

reviewText: I had seen a couple of these many years ago but never saw Papillon.  Didn't know it was a true story as the Getaway was and that chase in Bullitt through San Francisco streets---WOW.  Cincinnati Kid had so many stars in it that, that alone held your interest even if your not a card playing person as I'm not.  Of course, Steve McQueen was so good in so many films that you really can't go wrong with any of them.

reviewText: The movies are some of the best Steve McQueen did. The collection is released through Warner Bros., so you know your getting the best quality and it's just like buying the movies by themselves. There are four disks for four movies and the case is like a spindle, so all four disks are in one spindle. I watched all movies and I had no problem with any of them and they played through the movies with no flaws.All movies are in color and in Widescreen format and run for about 1hr 40min to over 2hrs. "Papillon" and "The Getaway" were released in the 70s and "Bullitt" and "Cincinnati Kid" were released in mid to late 60s. These movies star: Steve McQueen, Karl Malden, Ben Johnson, Dustin Hoffman, Robert Vaughn, Ann-Margret, Ali MacGraw, Jacqueline Bisset, Edward G. Robinson, Norman Fell, plus others!Overall this is a great collection of some of the best McQueen movies and I would recommend this to anyone who doesn't have any of these films.
